options.text: movement of sperm from urethra to testes
movement of sperm from epididymis to vas deferens
movement of sperm from vas deferens to urethra
movement of sperm from testes to urethra.

solution.text: Contraceptive methods avoid pregnancy. These can be Natural methods, Barrier methods, IUD's, Chemical methods, Surgical methods and Implants. Surgical methods include vasectomy in males and tubectomy in females. Vasectomy means a small part of vasa deferens is cut and ligated. This prevents movement of sperm from testes to urethra. Thus when such a male will ejaculate the semen will be without sperms and thus during coitus there will be no chance of sperm entering the female tract.
